result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Peter Dean was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric Peter Dean is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric Peter Dean was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Eric Peter Dean was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Eric Peter Dean was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: *9/16/2022Concurrent with Kenosha County case 16CF1055.
Concurrent with counts 2 and 3 and case 16CF1055 and any other sentence.  Credit for 0 days served.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Restitution set at $584.00 To be paid first to Kohls Department Store.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Restitution set at $584.00 To be paid first to Kohls Department Store.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Restitution set at $583.00 To be paid first to Kohls Department Store.

*9/28/2022  Restitution and court costs for counts 1, 2, and 3 to be paid by September 16, 2023. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.*
 AS TO EACH COUNT, COUNT ONE, TWO AND THREE:  Provide DNA sample.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim witness surcharge, restitution and assessments are to be collected by DOC at maximum rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision, reference to case 16CF1055.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Concurrent with: *9/28/2022 Concurrent with Kenosha County case 16CF1055.*
Concurrent with count 1 and 3 and case 16CF1055 and any other sentence.  Credit for 0 days.

 Concurrent with count 1 and 2 and case 16CF1055 and any other sentence.  Credit for 0 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Peter Dean

records.addlTxt: Placed on the record on today's date; COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3 are concurrent with Kenosha County case 16CF1055. Restitution and court costs for COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3 to be paid by September 16, 2023; any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.

Defendant Eric Peter Dean in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Eric Peter Dean.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeded.

AS TO COUNT 1, 2, AND 3.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 2 AND 3, and case 16CF1055, and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days served. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at $584.00; to be paid first to Kohl's Department Store.
-The court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) restitution and assessments are to be collected by DOC at MAXIMUM rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision; reference to case 16CF1055.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.  

AS TO COUNT 2.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 1 AND 3, and case 16CF1055, and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days served
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at $584.00; to be paid first to Kohl's Department Store.
-The court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) restitution and assessments are to be collected by DOC at MAXIMUM rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision; reference to case 16CF1055.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.  

AS TO COUNT 3.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 1 AND 2, and case 16CF1055, and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days served.  
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at $583.00; to be paid first to Kohl's Department Store.
-The court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) restitution and assessments are to be collected by DOC at MAXIMUM rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision; reference to case 16CF1055.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.  

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Received and Filed.  nk
Received and Filed: Motion in Limine
Victim Impact Statement.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Eric Peter Dean not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Eric Peter Dean in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Eric Peter Dean in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Store, 3737 S. 27th St., Milwaukee, WI

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Eric Peter Dean in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Eric Peter Dean in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric Peter Dean appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court orders count 4 dismissed without prejudice.     Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
